poem:
Of Politics and Hope

In the morning light,  
a new leaf turns,  
swift conviction stirs—  
out of old roots,  
springs courage anew.  
Traditions bind us,  
yet branches stray;  
in the fluttered wind,  
there lies a voice,  
hope not for glory,  
but for right—  
a whispered path,  
a mended heart.
